item.title: Over 200 Rockets Fired At Israel Military Bases, Claims Hezbollah
item.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah said it launched "more than 200" rockets at Israeli military positions Thursday in response to a strike that killed a senior commander of the Iran-backed group.

item.title: Britons Start Voting In Election Expected To Propel Labour To Power
item.description: Britons began voting on Thursday in a parliamentary election that is expected to bring Keir Starmer's Labour Party to power, sweeping away Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Conservatives after 14 often turbulent years.

item.title: Ukraines Forces Withdraw From Key Eastern Town As Russia Claims Control
item.description: Ukraine said Thursday its forces had withdrawn from a district in the key eastern town of Chasiv Yar, where Russian forces have recently claimed several advances.

item.title: Odds Against Him, UK PM Rishi Sunak Casts Vote With Wife Akshata Murty
item.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak urged voters to choose the Conservative party as polling booths opened across thecountry for the general election.He shared a photo with his wife, Akshata Murty, at a polling booth.

item.title: Europe Seeks to Solve the ‘Patriot Puzzle’ in Ukraine
item.description: With Ukraine clamoring for more air defenses, officials are trying to scrape together a Patriot battery from spare parts scattered across the continent.

item.title: Live updates: Britain votes in election that may end 14 years of Conservative rule
item.description: Rishi Sunak and his center-right Conservative Party may be on the way out, replaced by Keir Starmer and the left-leaning Labour Party.

item.title: In Brentwood, Essex, poll workers said they witnessed a “steady flurry” of voters this morning. I...
UK elections: what is tactical voting and how does it work?
item.description:
The campaign group Best for Britain has launched its guide on how to vote to have the best chance of ousting the Tories. We look at what tactical voting involves and what the group is recommending


UK general election live: latest updates

Continue reading...

item.title: Biden says ‘I’m not leaving’ as cracks appear in support | First Thing
item.description:
White House denies reports president is assessing candidacy. Plus, UK expected to elect Labour in landslide

Good morning.

President Joe Biden has struck a defiant tone and insisted to his campaign team that “I’m in this race to the end”, according to reports, despite the increasing pressure to step down as the Democratic nominee amid concerns over his competence.

Governors in show of qualified support. Democratic governors have rallied around Biden after a closed-door meeting yesterday but admitted they shared voters’ concerns about his performance, as a fresh poll shows Trump has a six-point advantage, 49-43%, over Biden among likely voters.

Stepping out. For three and a half years, Biden was wrapped in a metaphorical ball of cotton wool by an anxious White House staff eager to protect him from the worst of himself.

Waving the white flag? Senior Tories including one of Sunak’s closest cabinet allies were effectively conceding defeat yesterday. Starmer accused the Conservatives of trying to suppress voter turnout by presenting the election result as a done deal.

Continue reading...

item.title: As president teeters, Jill Biden faces a critical juncture
